name: Southern Lapwing
description: A large lapwing with overall grayish coloration, bronze-tinged wing bends, and a glossy black chest. Males and females look alike.
spread_note: Much of South America except tropical forests and highest mountain areas
image_alt: Southern Lapwing, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
reproduction: The female lays 4 eggs, incubation lasts 27 days.
attractions: Active mainly in the morning and evening, it often forages in larger groups and is highly vigilant, warning of danger with a piercing cry.
breeding: We acquired a pair in 2012, bred at Ruinen Zoo.
